chargeHist.descr: Violate No Contact Court Order (Felony Conviction)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Violate No Contact Court Order (Felony Conviction)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ezekiel L. Smith

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:24 PM Defendant Ezekiel L. Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Ezekiel L. Smith.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
State is in compliance with victim rights legislation and no victims appear at today's hearing.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on December 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:19 PM Defendant Ezekiel L. Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant states he has Atty Gary Kryshak.
Court review the court order appointing on the defendant's other case.
Jail to provide the defendant with the court appointed paperwork to complete and return to Judge Zell to have Atty Kryshak be appointed on this case.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.
 BY THE COURT: Bond continues.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Comply with all bond conditions in all his pending cases.
No direct or indirect contact with E. W.

1:05 PM Defendant Ezekiel L Smith appeared by video, in custody. Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of WI. Attorney Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.
ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant   is   eligible for public defender representation.
State requests a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant is informed that failure to comply with the conditions of the signature bond, may result in the bond being forfeited and monies being collected.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
